algorithm_technique: Two-pass prefix/suffix sum calculation to efficiently compute operations for each box.
problem_summary_simple: Calculate operations to move all balls to each box from its initial position.
problem_summary_technical: Uses a two-pass approach (left-to-right and right-to-left) to accumulate ball counts and distances, calculating total operations for each box.
key_insights: The total operations for a box `i` is the sum of distances from all balls to box `i`.
This can be broken down into operations from balls to the left and balls to the right.
A two-pass approach efficiently calculates these sums by maintaining running counts of balls and total distance.
